title: Spack Database Locks - Permission Issue?
body:
Hi

I pulled latest code from develop yesterday and now I am getting the following error when doing "spack find."

```
user@server[~]$ spack find
==> Error: Can't take exclusive lock on read-only file: /pbtech_mounts/softlib001/apps/EL6/spack/opt/spack/.spack-db/lock

user@server[~]$ ls -ltr /pbtech_mounts/softlib001/apps/EL6/spack/opt/spack/.spack-db/lock
-rwxr-xr-x 1 root root 27 May  4 08:11 /pbtech_mounts/softlib001/apps/EL6/spack/opt/spack/.spack-db/lock

```

As you can see the lock file is owned by root as is our entire NFS-exported spack installation.  I can run "spack find" as root on a node though the above error happens when ran as another non-root user.

Root owned everything before pulling the latest changes from git so I wanted to make sure that the problem isn't the permissions I have in place.

```
[root@node103 spack]# spack find | head
-- linux-rhel6-x86_64 / gcc@4.4.6 -------------------------------
autoconf@2.69
automake@1.15
bamtools@2.4.1
bcftools@1.4
bedtools2@2.26.0
binutils@2.28
binutils@2.28
bison@3.0.4
boost@1.63.0

[root@node103 spack]# ls -ltr /pbtech_mounts/softlib001/apps/EL6/spack/opt/spack/.spack-db
total 160
-rwxr-xr-x 1 root root     27 Apr 28 15:33 prefix_lock
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root 153869 Apr 28 15:44 index.json
-rwxr-xr-x 1 root root     27 May  4 08:20 lock
```
